comments:
Add the bug report functionality to the releng Release tool.

This update will remove the need to use the cvs-commit.sh script as all the work will be done from the wizard in java.

PW

Usecase 1:

1. From Project Compare page, check the generate build notes option

2. Select the build notes html file (it will be created for you if it doesn't exist)

3. copy out the displayed text for the email

4. Next will update the build notes html file

5. When committing your map files, the build notes html file should show up in the commit list.

PW

Aaron, we always do a delta between the map tag and HEAD, that's probably why parts of it didn't work for Tod.

We need to find the tag of the projects in the workspace.


PW

Here's the code to find the tag of the projects in the workspace

CVSWorkspaceRoot.getCVSResource(IProject).getFolderSync().getTag()

AF

So I'm guessing you are using:

CVSWorkspaceRoot.getCVSResourceFor(IResource).getSyncInfo().getTag()

PW

Aaron, could you enter a comment with a list of items that you  still have to complete?

Thanx,
PW

This is what I have left to complete:

-fix bug that is caused by using HEAD in remote log operation
-prepend output to selected build notes file

AF

Created an attachment (id=45307)
releng tool BuildNotesPage draft v01

This adds the optional "update the build notes" page.  It generates the bug numbers and update the selected build notes page that already exists, but it will not commit the build notes page.

Aaron

Aaron, connect with Tod on Monday or Tuesday please.  You can plan out the rest of your feature.

PW

Created an attachment (id=46077)
patch version 2

This patch fixes the NullPointerException by preventing someone from selecting to update the file without choosing a path.  It will update the changes to the buildnotes file in the local workspace, but will not submit it to the repository.  I will add that in the next patch.  This patch also adds reporting of changes from branches other than HEAD.

Aaron

Tod and I did a build submission yesterday and found some things that need work:

1). It should commit the build notes file first and then commit the map file, so the build notes file is released.

2.) The map file is updated even if the commit failed.

3.) Show the changes for the build notes file on the same page that shows the map file changes.

4.) If someone includes a number in their comments it is treated as a bug number even if it is not (for example, 2005) and if that bug number exists on Bugzilla, its summary is output.

Aaron

Created an attachment (id=46836)
patch

This patch adds functionality to commit and tag the updated build notes file along with the rest of the build submission.

Aaron

Created an attachment (id=47638)
new patch

This patch fixes the bug where the build notes page reported changes for bugs that were changed in previous builds.

AF

I have taken a quick look at the patch. One issue is that the ReleaseWizard class looks like it was reformatted. This is bad as it makes it look like there are a lot of changes when really there are only a few. If it is not too much trouble, I would prefer if the patch was recreated with only the real changes. If this is too much work then we will need to sit down together and go through the changes to ReleaseWizard.

Also, keep in mind that this tool is used weekly by all Eclipse teams to submit to the build so the introduction of any errors can have a wide effect. I am assuming that you have tested both the new and old workflows thoughoughly to ensure that no regressions were introduced (i.e. I am not planning on performing any tests on this since it is not technically production code).

Aaron, BTW, you need to attach the patch in response to comment #18

PW

Created an attachment (id=48378)
unformatted patch

This is the unformatted patch.

AF

Created an attachment (id=50082)
2006-09-13 patch

This patch fixes bugs 153983 and 154617, and has been cleaned up so the code is much easier to understand than previous patches.

AF

Created an attachment (id=50086)
2006-09-13 patch

Cleaned up some unnecessary output to console. 

AF
Patch released.
I also updated the plug-in version to 3.3 since this is a significant new feature.
I just did some testing and the build notes are written to stdout. The printlns should be removed (or a DEBUG flag used to turn them off).

Also, if you go all the way to the last page and then press back, all the previous pages are disabled. I don;t know if this was a problem introduced by the patch (i.e. a regression) or if it existed before. If it is a regression, it would be good if we could fix it. If it is a long standing bug, then I'm not as concerned about it.

(In reply to comment #26)
> Also, if you go all the way to the last page and then press back, all the
> previous pages are disabled. 

It might be that you are seeing bug 157044.

Created an attachment (id=50174)
2006-09-14 patch

Paul and I looked over the code and removed all sysouts, externalized all necessary strings, did some more tests and it all seems to be good.  This patch should also be submitted to HEAD.  Thanks.

AF
Patch released

Created an attachment (id=50386)
pattern change

This patch changes the pattern the tool looks for in commit comments. Instead of the pattern of just a bug number, ie "146820", it now searches for the pattern "bug 146820". This eliminates false data in the report caused by including a build number like 0010 in the comment. The patch has been tested and should be released to HEAD.

AF

I've reviewed the patch and it looks good.

PW
